Author: TheFalseProfit#5929
Content: If I use my seed to login to verus agama Lite mode I get an address. If I log in using the pin name and password I get a different address. Is this normal behaviour?

Author: TheFalseProfit#5929
Content: An unrelated query... agama sometimes shuts down in a few seconds. but sometimes takes 4 - 6 hours. Any clue as to why?

Author: TheFalseProfit#5929
Content: Are you saying native mode CAN take that long to shut down and its normal?

Author: TheFalseProfit#5929
Content: I reckon there's another one and it goes like this. Create a new wallet in Lite Mode (KMD). Copy and paste seed into notepad and save notepad. Repaste seed into confirm field. Type a seed encrypt key into notepad and save notepad. Enter encrypt key into agama field and confirm field.  Save QR code. Toggle custom name off. Hit register.  It's very difficult to make a mistake when done like that. The account will open. Copy the address and save in notepad.  This will be the address that seemingly cannot be got at again. Logout. Now login using the PIN and password and I can get a different address. The trouble is this happens only 'sometimes'. The very first account setup seems to be involved. Possibly  'Toggle custom name off'. I have repeated this a number of times now and as I'm trying to recover an account I'm being extremely careful. Reddit posts show a few other users having similar difficulties and komodo seem to bellieve its always user error. I beg to differ. I think there's a bug.

Author: TheFalseProfit#5929
Content: My system is windows 7, updated with all 'important'  updates. There's a whole slew of other updates not installed. Java is fully updated if that matters and so is .NET. I've reproduced this on 2 computers.
